intro: Claytonia colchaguensis, commonly known as the Andes mountain sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Claytonia colchaguensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
